BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: In particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain easily released wind slabs formed. The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack over a wide area especially at low and intermediate altitudes. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack over a wide area.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The snowpack will be moist in the southeast and in the southwest.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The early morning will see favourable conditions generally, but the danger of wet and gliding avalanches will increase later.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Some fresh snow as well as the mostly small wind slabs represent the main danger. The danger of moist small and medium sized avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at elevated altitudes precarious wind slabs formed. The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant above the tree line. As a consequence of solar radiation gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Some snow has fallen in some localities. The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects and generally at high altitude. Caution is to be exercised in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, as well as in places that are protected from the wind. Moist and wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses, in particular on steep slopes below approximately 2600 m, as well as at the base of rock walls above the tree line. Individual gliding avalanches can also occur.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the snowpack on shady slopes. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions. Avalanches can be released in the old snowpack, in particular by large additional loads.

The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack is largely stable and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases. In particular shady slopes high altitudes and the high Alpine regions: Towards its surface, the snowpack is dry; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Above approximately 1000 m snow will fall over a wide area. Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the precipitation.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The new snow and wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The fresh snow as well as the resulting wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence. This applies in particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation. In all aspects medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible. Avalanches can be released, in particular by large loads. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The new snow and wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack in many places. As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust will form on the surface during the next few days. In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cloudy over a wide area. Light precipitation.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh and older wind slabs represent the main danger. The snowpack will be generally favourable.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from northwesterly directions, mostly small wind slabs formed on Sunday. They have formed in particular from the western part of the northern flank of the Alps to the border to France. The avalanche prone locations are to be found on very steep slopes above approximately 2500 m and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. They are in some cases prone to triggering. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions these avalanche prone locations are more widespread and the danger is slightly greater. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. Hardly any more moist and wet avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In the western part of the northern flank of the Alps, along the border with France in some regions 5 cm of snow has fallen since the late morning. The wind was strong.
The weather was cold. These harsh wintry weather conditions gave rise to rapid consolidation of the snowpack over a wide area.
In particular shady slopes high altitudes and the high Alpine regions: The upper section of the snowpack is dry; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The new snow of Tuesday will be deposited on a crust on very steep sunny slopes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh wind slabs require caution. Gliding avalanches and loose snow avalanches require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, avalanche prone wind slabs formed in some places. Caution is to be exercised in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, as well as adjacent to ridgelines in all aspects in high Alpine regions. Avalanches are only small but can be released even by a single winter sport participant.

A latent danger of gliding avalanches exists. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Avalanches can reach medium size. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

In addition further mostly small loose snow avalanches are possible. This applies on extremely steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Over a wide area 2 to 5 cm of snow has fallen since Saturday above approximately 1500 m. The wind was strong in some cases.
Fresh wind slabs are lying on soft layers in particular on shady slopes at elevated altitudes.
The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack especially on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather conditions will foster a gradual strengthening of the snow drift accumulations. Gliding snow requires caution.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh wind slabs require caution. Gliding avalanches and loose snow avalanches require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, avalanche prone wind slabs formed in some places. Caution is to be exercised in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, as well as adjacent to ridgelines in all aspects in high Alpine regions. Avalanches are only small but can be released even by a single winter sport participant.

A latent danger of gliding avalanches exists. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Avalanches can reach medium size. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

In addition further mostly small loose snow avalanches are possible. This applies on extremely steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Over a wide area 5 to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Saturday above approximately 1500 m. The wind was strong in some cases.
Fresh wind slabs are lying on soft layers in particular on shady slopes at elevated altitudes.
The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack especially on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather conditions will foster a gradual strengthening of the snow drift accumulations. Gliding snow requires caution.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Snow profiles and stability tests have shown the favourable bonding of the snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The snowpack will be generally well bonded. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
As the temperature drops hardly any more moist and wet avalanches are to be expected.

In very isolated cases weak layers exist in the snowpack on shady slopes. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack is favourably layered and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases. Field observations have indicated good snowpack stability.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Above approximately 1000 m snow will fall over a wide area. Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the precipitation.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet snow slides and avalanches are possible in isolated cases. These are small.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Only isolated mostly small wet snow slides and avalanches are possible above approximately 1900 m. In gullies and bowls a sometimes precarious avalanche situation will be encountered in some localities.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Below approximately 1900 m no snow is lying. The older wind slabs are to be found especially in gullies and bowls and at high altitudes. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to gradual and thorough wetting of the old snowpack over a wide area.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be in most cases wet all the way through.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual weakening of the snowpack as the day progresses.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be in most cases wet all the way through.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual weakening of the snowpack as the day progresses.

Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found on extremely steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Avalanches are small and can mostly only be released by large loads.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack will be stable over a wide area.
The wind was strong at times. The wind slabs are lying on soft layers in particular on very steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes.
The snowpack is moist and its surface has a crust. The solar radiation will give rise to moistening of the snowpack especially on steep sunny slopes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found on extremely steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Avalanches are small and can mostly only be released by large loads.

In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Only a little snow is now lying. The snowpack will be generally stable. The snowpack is moist and its surface has a crust. The solar radiation will give rise to moistening of the snowpack especially on steep sunny slopes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gliding snow requires caution. Wind slabs at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
A latent danger of gliding avalanches exists. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Avalanches can reach medium size. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

As a consequence of a strong wind from westerly directions, mostly small wind slabs formed in isolated cases. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m. These places are rather rare and are clearly recognisable to the trained eye. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

In addition individual small loose snow avalanches are possible. This applies on extremely steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Some snow has fallen since Saturday in some regions. The wind was strong in some cases.
Fresh wind slabs are lying on soft layers in particular on shady slopes at elevated altitudes.
The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack especially on steep sunny slopes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found on extremely steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Avalanches are small and can mostly only be released by large loads.

In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Only a little snow is now lying. The snowpack will be generally stable. The snowpack is moist and its surface has a crust. The solar radiation will give rise to moistening of the snowpack especially on steep sunny slopes.
